messages.title: But what about Brexit?
messages.content: In the run up to the referendum, Labour was clear that we believed Britain's future was brighter within the EU. We were successful in convincing most of our supporters but not the wider public. Since then, Theresa May has invoked Article 50 and has been busy burning bridges with Brussels, seemingly intent on a most chaotic and catastrophic brexit. Other parties have floated the idea of a second referendum. I believe this would achieve nothing more than entrench the divisions that the referendum created, and lose us precious negotiating time with Brussels. The clock is ticking! I believe Labour has the right brexit strategy. We will negotiate the best deal we can, prioritising jobs, the economy, the environment, workers' rights and consumer protections. If elected, I would fight for the right of the British people to look at the final brexit deal and have the final say on whether the deal we have negotiated is what they want for Britain.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will negotiate the best deal prioritising jobs, the economy, the environment, workers' rights and consumer protections.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour believed Britain's future was brighter within the EU. The deal negotiated by the Conservatives is deemed chaotic and catastrophic.

contactInformation.address: Ashford Labour, Elliot House, Oakenpole Ln, Ashford, Kent, TN25 7PS

endorsements.endorsement: "As a small businesswoman working in the town I believe Labour has the best policies for jobs and economic growth. I encourage everyone to Vote Labour on June 8th"
"I’m delighted to endorse Sally as the Labour Candidate for Ashford. Ashford needs Sally as their MP to ensure our residents’ voice are really heard in Westminster"
